subject: p15109122
History: Oxygen requirement status post vascular procedures on right leg. Patient with history of CHF and CAD.
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study. Large bilateral pleural effusions have increased. Bibasilar atelectasis have increased, more on the left. Cardiomegaly and low lung volumes are stable. Transvenous pacer leads terminate in the standard position in the right atrium and the right ventricle. Mild pulmonary edema is new. Sternal wires are aligned. Right PICC tip is obscured by transvenous pacer leads.
